result.execSummary:
All charges against Ricardo Christopher Foster-Thornton in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ricardo Christopher Foster-Thornton is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by Use Of A Dangerous Weapon (Pointing)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricardo Christopher Foster-Thornton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ricardo Christopher Foster-Thornton in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a jury trial. Parties are prepared to proceed. Court passes case.

CASE RECALLED. SAME APPEARANCES.  Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.

Defendant Ricardo Christopher Foster-Thornton in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 08/15/2022 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.

Defendant Ricardo Christopher Foster-Thornton in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ricardo Christopher Foster-Thornton in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Remaining cash bail posted to be returned to the remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SGI.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Ricardo Christopher Foster-Thornton in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 29.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/22/2022@1:00
